name: Protein
subtitle: Bioschemas specification describing the usage of BiologicalEntity for the “Protein” biological type.
description: This protein specification presents the usage of the generic type BiologicalEntity by the biological type “protein”. Please be aware “protein” is NOT a schema.org type but a BiologicalEntity profile.

new_props.name: distribution
new_props.sdo_desc: A downloadable form of this entity, at a specific location, in a specific format

new_props.name: associatedDisease
new_props.sdo_desc: Disease associated to this protein feature

new_props.name: biocoordinates
new_props.sdo_desc: Coordinates in a 1 or 2D space, for instance length/coordinates in a sequence.  Usage (example): Use a QuantitativeValue with properties minValue and maxValue for a region or value for a site in a Protein. Use it only with value for a protein length.

new_props.name: biologicalType
new_props.sdo_desc: List with types preferably supported by BioSchemas-> enumeration list of values maintained on a wikipage (cf accessibilityAPI in schema.org for implementation). If the value is not on the list then the data will still be parsed but only generic properties will be validated. {population,individual,tissue,cell,molecule,protein,nucleic acid}

new_props.name: crossReference
new_props.sdo_desc: A pointer to another, somehow related entity. Usage: Whenever isBasedOn/isBasisFor, isPartOf/hasPart, citation or any other more specific does not work.

new_props.name: representation
new_props.sdo_desc: Representation of this entity. For instance, chemical structure or sequence

new_props.name: taxon
new_props.sdo_desc: A url pointing to NCBI Taxonomy or a taxonomic resource

new_props.name: isMentionedIn
new_props.sdo_desc: CreativeWork, Dataset, collection mentioning this entity  Inverse of:mentions

new_props.name: additionalProperty
new_props.sdo_desc: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.  Avoid it if possible, otherwise use it carefully. Please keep in mind that Bioschemas does not pretend to model every single possible field but mainly those useful for discoverability, summarization and accessibility.

CreativeWork.name: citation
CreativeWork.sdo_desc: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

CreativeWork.name: dateCreated
CreativeWork.sdo_desc: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

CreativeWork.name: dateModified
CreativeWork.sdo_desc: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

CreativeWork.name: hasPart
CreativeWork.sdo_desc: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

CreativeWork.name: isPartOf
CreativeWork.sdo_desc: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

Thing.name: identifier
Thing.sdo_desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

Thing.name: image
Thing.sdo_desc: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.sdo_desc: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
